attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp

attributes.action: Don't sell Linton-on-ouse
attributes.background: Keep RAF Linton on ouse open it's the best fast jet training facility

attributes.action: Make all goods vehicles to have speed limiters set at the national speed limit
attributes.background: Legislation needs to be in place making all goods vehicles speed limiters set at the national speed limit in order to reduce overtaking . At present hauliers set their vehicles at a speed of their choice. This causes bunching of LGV's and causes unnecessary overtaking .

attributes.action: Work with EU to allow promotion/marketing of infant formula milk(under 6months)
attributes.background: Currently you are unable to to gain advantage points from supermarkets and reatailers such as boots on formula milk (for under 6 months) you can also not buy formula with these advantage points. This is due to a law that prevents the promotion or discount of formula milk for under 6 month olds.
attributes.additional_details: the price of formula is regulated as to stop 'formula shopping' and prevent people from buying the cheapest formula they can find, as this enables mother/fathers to use one brand or staggared brands through out infancy- they were finding that babies where becoming really unwell by getting fed different formulas every week. It also prevents supermarkets trying to push formula that is close to expire. But parents should be able to gain advantage points on buying formula milk.

attributes.action: Make an insurance on the car itself instead of the individuals who drive it
attributes.background: The insurance in many countries like Portugal, Poland or America is made on car itself instead of individuals who drive it. This would make it easier for everyone as people will be able to drive the car even if they are not its owner and will not pay huge amounts for borrowing it.
attributes.additional_details:
In the Portugal the road traffic fatalities are decreasing with each year as young people can learn to drive with their parents car. In the 2010, there was 937 road traffic fatalities and through 5 years it has decreased to 593.
Making this change in the country will allow people to save more money on the insurances and will allow young people to drive and learn on their parents car without buying separate insurance, which can cost a lot.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for councils to have zebra crossings outside every school
attributes.background: Road Safety around children should be compulsory and precautions outside every school regardless of incidents. If there’s children crossing we need to keep them safe at all costs.
attributes.additional_details: I think that not enough is done for road safety of our children. Lollipop ladies don’t seem to exist anymore and where we are in a rural town road safety isn’t consider necessary by Kent County Council they insist on a number of incidents occurring or a fatality. It shouldn’t take something to happen for precautions to be in place. There should be a zebra crossing outside every school!

attributes.action: 6 points on the persons driving licence if caught leaving a dog in a hot car
attributes.background: People who leave their dogs in baking hot cars should be disciplined with 6 points on their driving licence and reported directly to the RSPCA.

attributes.action: Introduce a Licencing system for cyclists and tighten up cycle law.
attributes.background:
Recently a facebook post caused horror and cyclists regularly show little regard for other road users and the law.

Please debate introducing a licence, at least with theory tests similar to other vehicles, which all cyclists must pass and must carry at all times and have 3rd party insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
I once received verbal abuse from a cyclist feeling I was in the wrong. I had dash cam footage reviewed by the police who were horrified how many highway code points the cyclist broke. The cyclist could not be traced so no action was taken but it's typical of the lack of knowledge of cyclists.

I am a horse rider, cyclist, motorcyclist, and car driver. The group I see least consideration for road users and frequent law breaking is cyclists.

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to have regular contact with their children.
attributes.background: Parents who choose not see their children regularly subject them to feelings of abandonment. More action and strict policies should be in place to enforce regular contact. Where possible, children need their both parents.

attributes.action: Mandatory 5 year prison sentence for carrying a knife on the first offence
attributes.background: The streets of the United Kingdom have been lost to knife wielding thugs who suffer  little or no consequence for their actions. Social media and local news is awash with videos and images of knives on our streets. The two strike rule has failed. A mandatory 5 year sentence must be enforced for all.

attributes.action: Make childcare free from one year old
attributes.background: Childcare at the moment is only free from two if you have special circumstances, all other children have to wait til 3. If childcare was free from a year old a lot more parents would have the oppurtunity work or work more hours that cant currently because of the price of childcare.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment for a child under three years old to attend a full day of nursery the average price is around £50 a day. Family's who are living on lower incomes  can't afford this and many are reducing their hours or giving up work completely as the money they are spending can be as much as or nearly as much as they are earning.

attributes.action: Scrap the 2 child limit on the benefits system
attributes.background: Limiting the children in the benefit system to 2 only. is causing unfair hardship on families.Some single mothers have absent fathers. who if forced to pay out benefits can pay as little as £1.50 pw, with no government help. how can this be fair upon the child they abandoned..

attributes.action: Do not remain in the EEA
attributes.background:
Remaining in the EEA will stop the UK becoming the sovereign nation that was voted for in the referendum.
All the promises of new trade deals will become token at best.
Nations outside of the EU has warned against staying in the EU like this and we demand parliament does as was told by the people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/alexander-downer-warns-uk-of-irrelevancy-over-soft-brexit-plans/news-story/c967595695165c994395d81fbb91e100

attributes.action: Make 8th May 'Attenborough Day' - a bank holiday for visiting nature.
attributes.background: Sir David Attenborough is one of the greatest Britons of the past 100 years. Rather than putting him on a plastic bank note or a commemorative coin, mark his Birthday with a public holiday for getting into nature and cleaning up our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Doing good things, especially outside, makes people happier. Happier people make happier workers means greater production. It’s a win win.

attributes.action: Debate the impact of Trump's visit on the UK's security and reputation
attributes.background: Since moving into the White House, Mr Trump has shown an impatience bordering on intolerance toward peaceful protests, the media and even the democratic process itself. So his visit to Britain will be an important opportunity to underline the importance of free speech and the right to protest.

attributes.action: Continue benefit payments while processing Universal Credit
attributes.background: UC is the total of all benefits that a person will claim. Once UC has been processed, and the amount payable is known, then deduct or add accordingly HB/CT/ESA etc. with the remainder being the claimant's entitlement. This will prevent risking lives/ homes or the need for food banks in the meantime.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for food products to have carbon print and water usage labels
attributes.background:
The current rate of climate change is having devastating effects on the planet with natural disasters becoming more commonplace.
Some food products are much more carbon and water intensive in production than others and having these labels will allow us to be more informed.
attributes.additional_details:
With around 10% of the UK’s carbon emissions in 2016 coming from domestic agriculture https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/679334/2016_Final_Emissions_Statistics_one_page_summary.pdf
we should consider ways in which to reduce this.

Companies like Tesco once opted to add carbon labels to some food products on a voluntary basis; however, they then dropped this policy in part due to other retailers failing to follow suit.

attributes.action: An accepted offer on a house is a binding contract, withdrawal incurs 5% penalty
attributes.background: When we bought our house, the vendor withdrew at the last minute and selling our current house, more than one buyer withdrew at the last minute and in each case, leaving us with considerable inconvenience and unforeseen financial consequences. This will stop chains collapsing.

attributes.action: Ban horse racing
attributes.background: Horses are whipped and forced to run around tracks that are often made of hard-packed dirt at speeds of more than 30 miles per hour while carrying people on their backs. Racehorses are the victims of a multibillion-dollar industry that has problems with drug abuse, injuries and race fixing.
attributes.additional_details: When they stop winning races or become injured, some owners don’t want to pay for a horse who doesn’t bring in any money. Many end up in slaughterhouses where they are turned into dog food and glue. They may endure days of transport in tiny trailers where there is no access to water, food and injuries are common. Horses tend to thrash about in order to avoid being shot by the gun, which is supposed to render them unconscious before their throats are cut.

attributes.action: OFSTED to closely monitor training qualifications provided by care organisations
attributes.background: All care companies should have, their training programmes Ofsted inspected, and assessors to hold the minimum of a teaching degree.
attributes.additional_details: Currently care companies, self regulate their in house training programmes. This leaves their training programmes wide open not only to educational fraud, but also the substandard delivery and assessment of  in-house training programmes. Each in-house training programme should also lead to a nationally recognised qualification. Which should be standardised internally and externally.

attributes.action: Do not impose same-sex marriage on religious minorities
attributes.background: We call on Parliament, now and in the future, to continue to uphold the fundamental human right of religious minorities (Christians, Muslims, Jews and others) not to have same-sex marriage imposed on us, as guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
attributes.additional_details:
The right of religious minorities not to have same-sex marriage imposed on them was guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ which was included in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013 when same-sex marriage was legalized in the UK.

We call on Parliament to continue to uphold and respect this fundamental human right.

We remind Parliament that one of its key functions in a democratic society is to protect minorities from the ‘tyranny of the majority.’

attributes.action: Revoke all Diplomatic and Economic ties with South Africa
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the current ANC leadership, I would like to see the same type of action taken as was put in place against the National Party in the 70’s and 80’s. The ANC needs to be put under pressure for the welfare of ALL South Africans.

attributes.action: Give parents paid leave for school closure/sickness for their children
attributes.background: I find it ever so unfair when you work hard to support your children, children are far more likely to pick up bugs and illnesses, parent should not have to lose pay or take holiday to cover the time off to look their child it should paid by the employer
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was recently admitted into hospital, she was there for a week, I had to take it as holiday because i would lose a lot of money if I took it as sick.... firstly I’m not sick and secondly it’s not a holiday, I should be entitled to get paid time off for my child care, but it must be proven time off obviously, I however took it as holiday as I had no choice, this I feel is unfair as you should no be punished for a child sickness, I would work if I was ill, but children are different

attributes.action: Have a UK passport only channel in U.K. airports.
attributes.background:
Every time I fly throughout the year I am constantly in a huge queue to enter my home country!
It is so frustrating to have a UK/EU passport channel where 75% of the people are not UK citizens. We are one of the only countries where our own citizens queue to come HOME.
attributes.additional_details:
We shouldn’t have to be in a long queue where most of those are EU not U.K. citizens. Priority should be given to British passport holders just as every other country does by having U.K. passport ONLY lanes too.
Even the queues for non EU/UK passports is often smaller and quicker and it’s really a kick in the teeth to queue when in other counties airports at the border and then also at the border when you get home!

attributes.action: Food labelling re sugar to simple & straight forward for all
attributes.background:
I believe all foodstuffs should just have a picture of a spoon of  sugar with a number on it denoting the amount in total in that product.
There are too many guises for sugar that consumers do not understand.

attributes.action: Beat corporate tax avoidance by introducing Sales Tax based on Delivery Address
attributes.background: Big companies like Amazon, with turnovers in the UK in the billions, get away with paying next to no corporation tax.  Introduce a Delivery Sales Tax, based on the postcode being delivered to.  Claw back this money which is currently flowing overseas.  We could do this by monitoring at the courier.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be simple to legislate to require delivery companies to keep a log of:

a) Origin Company
b) Delivery Postcode
c) Declared value of item
d) Unique Shipping ID

Issue each company with an annual tax bill based on a fair percentage of the total value of all items delivered in the UK.

Failure to declare adequate value of a package would invalidate its insurance.

Spot checks would be simple - make occasional test orders to random addresses.  Incorrect declarations would be fined harshly.

attributes.action: Seek to extend the A50 period so that there can be a better deal/final vote
attributes.background: The government is making a hash of the Brexit negotiations and needs more time to agree the deal or allow the public a vote on what Brexit could look like in practice.

attributes.action: Introduce a benefit payment to all diagnosis of cancer patients
attributes.background: When you are diagnosed with cancer your world is turned upside down for the patient and there familys many cancer victims are off work for long periods of time with no help from the government am asking the government to provide a benefit to help them fight this awful disease and make life easier
attributes.additional_details: Cancer is a five year programme and can return at anyone point during the five years

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to £100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of £150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: The practice of unsolicited credit limit increases should be banned.
attributes.background: The Financial Conduct Authority has limited the use of unsolicited credit card limit increases, but it is not enough. There are still people actively being given these when there is no hope of them paying them off if they used them.
attributes.additional_details:
The FCA reports: "Our analysis of 2014 data showed that receiving a credit limit increase is associated with an increase in spending, with accounts that received a credit limit increase having an average balance £458 higher at the end of the year. The average credit limit increase was £1,321."

The finance industry is therefore actively encouraging people to spend more money and get further into debt. 

https://www.fca.org.uk/publication/consultation/cp17-43.pdf

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: Raise  Housing Benefits in accordance with Market Prices
attributes.background: The benefits system offers a miserly level of rent , expecting recipients to  manage in a housing market with prices far outstripping the benefit available.
attributes.additional_details: It is virtually impossible to find a home at the price the government claims is available for renting. Recipients are penalised for renting a place with two beds, even when one beds are limited, and many people cannot meet the cost of rent in this country. This is forcing many people into homelessness and rewarding greedy private landlords, while many renters are trying to meet excess costs out of their limited finances. Market value is not being taken into account where Housing Benefits are concerned.  Social Housing and cheap, good homes are not available, and market costs are ridiculously high, resulting in a dismal market, and a head in the clouds response from the government in tackling the housing crisis on all levels. Raise the level of Housing Benefit in line with the market.

attributes.action: Require 70% of National Park members be directly elected, 30% being appointees.
attributes.background: Residents of Parks have no vote on the policies and expenditure that affect much of their daily lives and yet they are taxpayers.  All present members are appointees who have no manifesto and no mandate; further, many appear as sinecures given to loyal foot-soldiers across the political spectrum.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the National Parks Authorities are each appointed by one of 3 routes: by the SoS; by local authorities overlapping a Park; by amalgams of Park Parishes.  Much as the power devolved to a Park is supposedly limited to Planning and environmental protection, by the control of funds and staff, the Authorities have more all-pervasive impacts on the lives of residents of the Parks than their local authorities that tax them.  The proposed 30%, SoS appointees represent special-interests.

attributes.action: Make the penalties for breaking election rules far stronger
attributes.background:
Vote Leave breaking electoral law in the referendum is the latest in a string of electoral scandals. 

The fines are so small as to be seen as a reasonable cost to parties and campaign groups. Penalties should include greater fines, prison and even annulment of results.

attributes.action: Brexit re article 50 it must not be suspended/stopped under any circumstances
attributes.background: the full details are well known to everyone the media has covered it fully
attributes.additional_details: the british people MUST be given the Brexit they voted for anything else is not acceptable to the british public  ARTICLE 50 must not under any circumstances be hindered/suspended/stopped for any reason whatsoever  the time is here to take action as there has been excessive feet dragging/delaying tactics by those opposed to brexit

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: Introduce yearly mental health checks on the NHS
attributes.background: With how society is nowadays, it is very easy to find yourself struggling. An annual mental health check will give everyone a chance to talk about their feelings to a trained professional who will be able to react to this in a more proactive way than a friend who may not know how to deal with it.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide is now at its all time highest, with it being the most common cause of death for men aged 20-49 across England and Wales. More and more pressures have emerged that we as humans were not originally designed to deal with such as financial worries, the rise of social media and having demanding jobs so there is no wonder 1 in 15 of us have made a suicide attempt at some point in our lives.

attributes.action: Reduce the TV license fee and privatise the BBC
attributes.background:
The BBC was created as a government funded TV channel when there were very few other options. Today, with hundreds of alternative channels, the BBC is not needed.

The TV license should ONLY be for maintenance of broadcasting equipment, and the BBC should be self funded like all other TV channels.
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal is to make the BBC a privately funded channel, as all others are, with commercials and/or subscription fees. Approximately 11% of license fees are spent on the infrastructure and broadcasting equipment, the rest is spent on BBC programming and administation,  and chasing license fees. 

By making the BBC private, more people will be able to watch live TV without having to pay a hefty fee for a service they don't use.

attributes.action: Male Suicide Prevention Strategy
attributes.background: According to the ONS, "of the 5,965 suicides registered in 2016, a total of 4,508 were male and 1,457 were female." We call on HM Government to take urgent and meaningful action to identify main factors that contribute to men in the UK being three times more likely to commit suicide than women.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the PM to establish a panel on Male Suicide Prevention, whose job would be to undertake public consultation and produce a comprehensive report on male suicide in the UK; with key findings and recommendations leading to the publication of the Government's first ever UK-wide Male Suicide Prevention Strategy.

"The fall in suicide rates from 2015 to 2016 is the largest decrease in 20 years. It fell for both males and females in the UK, although men still account for 3/4 of all suicides."

attributes.action: Support the 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' to regulate nurdle handling
attributes.background: Nurdles are small plastic pellets used in the production of plastic products.  Due to poor handling and lack of regulation, nurdles have become a huge source of pollution to our oceans and waterways.  Visit https://cans.blog to see more.
attributes.additional_details: Once spilt into marine environments nurdles absorb toxic chemicals and pose an immediate danger to wildlife as their size makes them easily mistaken for food.  The 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' has written a piece of secondary legislation that specifies methods to regulate all nurdle handling in the UK and UK waters.  This legislation will force anyone handling over 2KG of nurdles to be registered and agree to the highest standards of care when handling nurdles.

attributes.action: Re-think the current legislation criminalising cannabis.
attributes.background: The governments response to a similar petition stated that they are basing policy on a 10 year old report done under labour, I'm asking the government to re-think this policy by conducting a new, up to date and relevant study to bring our legislation up to modern standards.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of Pyrotechnics at UK football grounds
attributes.background: The majority of countries within Europe and South America allow fans to use pyrotechnics such as smoke bombs and flares at football matches however current law states that in UK they are not allowed and the use of them can lead to stadium bans as well as custodial sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Football banning orders for use of pyrotechnics are at minimum 3 years through a court and can go up to 10 years. Even if you are caught with the smoke bomb in a bag search, the punishments can be just as harsh as if you had let it off.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for any British politician to lie or deceive UK citizens
attributes.background: Politicians seem to be able to say what they want without being held to account, if there was some kind of criminal action that can be taken to insure a little bit more truth in their actions and words. Perhaps this force them to be honest with the British public.

attributes.action: All Mainstream Schools should have the resources to teach deaf children.
attributes.background: Pupils with special needs have a basic right to a mainstream education and the increased opportunity for social interaction with their peers that this brings. Mainstream participation allows everybody the opportunity to learn to understand the diversity of human ability, without prejudice.
attributes.additional_details:
In Manchester there are currently only 2 schools with the resource to teach deaf children. Both in the same area of Manchester, so the council pay to transport children from all over Manchester to these 2 schools. To clarify 'resource' is a room where a teacher for the deaf can do some quiet work with the deaf children. 
There are new schools being built all the time, surely this is a perfect opportunity to add the resource bases the schools need. The deaf teachers are already here and trained.

attributes.action: Apology from British government for 1919 Jallianwala Bagh Massacre in India
attributes.background: On 13 April 1919, Col R. Dyer of British Indian Army ordered soldiers to fire onto a crowd of pilgrims gathered in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar, India to celebrate the holy festival of Baishakhi. Dyer got all exits blocked to deliver maximum fatality killing hundreds of innocent unarmed civilians
attributes.additional_details:
Well documented incident which is the worst among many crimes committed by the colonising British. The pre-planned massacre puts the official deaths as 387. Dyer admitted that 1650 rounds were fired into a trapped crowd including elderly, kids and women. Unofficially casualties are estimated to be over 1000.

On the centenary of this horrific crime, the british government must tender an apology to the people of India in 2019

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jallianwala_Bagh_massacre#The_massacre

attributes.action: lift the flight ban to sharm el sheikh
attributes.background: we have had wonderful holidays in sharm el sheikh,  It is time for this ridiculous ban to be ended and to help the egyptians in sharm to get back on their feet. It seems all other countries are now able to fly direct to sharm except the uk, please lift the ban.

attributes.action: Review GB Domestic Driving hours.
attributes.background: 5.5 hours driving with a 30 minute break followed by another 4.5 hours driving is surely a health and safety issue. Bring it inline with EU Driving hours. 4.5 hours driving then a 45 minute break.
